title: World War II: The Horror of War in Pictures
annotation: This source provides visual documentation of the horrors of World War II, helping to illustrate the importance of the Geneva Convention's protections for civilians and medical personnel during wartime. The images demonstrate the real-world impact and necessity of international humanitarian law.

Middle East Conflict and Civilian Protection

title: In the name of mercy give
annotation: This World War I era poster illustrates how the principles of the Geneva Convention influenced humanitarian aid campaigns. The image helps demonstrate the lasting impact of the convention on public consciousness and humanitarian efforts.

title: Gray Ladies of the American Red Cross
annotation: This historical photograph shows the Gray Ladies of the Red Cross at work, illustrating how the Geneva Convention's principles led to expanded roles for women in humanitarian service. The image helps visualize the convention's impact on humanitarian aid development.

title: Ethiopian Conflict
annotation: This Associated Press photograph from the Ethiopian conflict illustrates modern applications of Geneva Convention principles in internal conflicts. The image helps visualize how the conventions continue to shape humanitarian responses in contemporary warfare.

title: Henry Dunant (young)
annotation: This early photograph of Henry Dunant shows the founder of the Red Cross and initiator of the Geneva Convention in his youth, before his experience at Solferino. We use this image to help visualize the key figure behind the convention's creation and to provide historical context.

title: Red Cross Conference on Nuclear Weapons
annotation: This photograph from the Red Cross conference shows modern discussions about applying Geneva Convention principles to nuclear weapons. The image illustrates how the convention continues to evolve in response to new challenges in warfare and international relations.

title: Signing of the Geneva Convention
annotation: This photograph captures the historic signing of the 1949 Geneva Convention, a pivotal moment in expanding humanitarian protections. We use this image to illustrate the formal process of establishing international humanitarian law and the broad international participation in the conventions.

title: Geneva Convention World War II
annotation: This World War II era photograph illustrates the historical context that led to major revisions of the Geneva Conventions. The image helps visualize the wartime conditions that prompted the expansion of humanitarian protections in the 1949 conventions.

title: Middle East: De-escalation and protection of civilians urgently needed
source: International Committee of the Red Cross
annotation: This article demonstrates the continued relevance and application of the Geneva Conventions in modern conflicts, particularly regarding civilian protection. We use this to show how the principles established by the First Geneva Convention continue to influence humanitarian responses today.

title: Women an Important Part of Red Cross History
annotation: This article discusses the role of women in the Red Cross, particularly the Gray Ladies, showing how the Geneva Convention's principles led to broader humanitarian participation. We use this to demonstrate the convention's impact on expanding humanitarian service opportunities.

title: Ethiopia: Status of western Tigray to be settled by law
annotation: This article covers the Ethiopian conflict and humanitarian concerns, demonstrating the ongoing relevance of Geneva Convention principles in modern internal conflicts. We use this to show how the conventions continue to shape discussions about humanitarian law in contemporary conflicts.

title: Red Cross conference fails to agree on nuclear weapons ban amid global tensions
annotation: This article discusses modern challenges in implementing Geneva Convention principles in the context of nuclear weapons and global tensions. We use this to demonstrate how the convention continues to evolve and face new challenges in contemporary international relations.

title: Geneva Convention
annotation: This comprehensive overview of the Geneva Convention provides historical context and explains its evolution through World War II. We use this source to understand how the conventions adapted to changing warfare and humanitarian needs, particularly focusing on the visual materials that document this evolution.
